string.text: Polymer buffer
Adding a polymer buffer to the return mechanism absorbs some of the recoil energy generated by firing.
Barrel alignment
Calibrate barrel alignment with the sights and remove any excessive movement that occurs during the firing cycle.
Change the barrel's twist rate
Increases muzzle velocity for a flatter trajectory and faster time-to-impact. Useful for long range shots.
Protective coating
The application of a special coating to the moving components can significantly reduce the amount of wear they receive.
Calibrate the trigger group
Precision adjustment and balancing of the trigger components allows for higher accuracy and reduced recoil.
Combined tactical module
The Insight AN/PEQ-16a tactical unit combines the functions of a narrow-field flashlight and laser sight. Particularly useful in low-light conditions.
Ergonomic grip
Installation of a more comfortable grip.
Lightweight alloy components
Replacing standard parts with lightweight alloys significantly reduces the weight of the gun.
Replace the magazine spring
Replacing the standard magazine spring with one that exerts a similar amount of force, but compresses to a lower height, allows the magazine to hold a slightly larger number of cartridges.
Revision of the feeding mechanism
The ammunition feeding assembly has been redesigned to reduce the number of jams from cartridge misfeeding or alignment issues.
Install a hardened extractor
Improves overall reliability of the weapon by reducing the number of common ejection issues that can occur after firing.
Tritium inserts
Installation of luminous night-sights allows for easier target acquisition in low-light conditions.
Tactical handle

Installation of a tactical handle under the barrel makes the gun easier to handle and allows the shooter to compensate for recoil more effectively. Installation also includes a replacement forend with Picatinny rails, allowing for additional tactical accessories to be mounted.
Reinforced trigger assembly
A refined trigger assembly allows for a faster rate of fire at the expense of some overall reliability.
Lightweight forend
Reduces the overall weight of the weapon.
Balance the bolt group
Balancing of the bolt group components reduces the barrel's departure from line of sight when firing, and also reduces the probability of hang-fires.
Chamber alignment
Careful fitment of parts and minimization of backlash in the chamber for a better seal, improving accuracy.
Lightweight stock
Replacing the stock with a lightweight alternative reduces the overall weight of the weapon.
Improved buttstock
Installation of an anatomical rubberized buttstock reduces the recoil felt by the shooter.
Align the bolt mechanism
Precise adjustment of the bolt components allows for higher accuracy.
Firing rate inhibitor
Allows the shooter more time to re-acquire their target between shots and compensate for muzzle climb, effectively leading to better accuracy, ammunition economy, and longevity of the weapon.
